intro: Homalomena santubongensis, commonly known as the Santubong arrowhead, is a species of flowering plant in the Araceae family. It is native to Borneo and is characterized by its arrowhead-shaped leaves that are typically dark green with a glossy texture. The plant produces striking inflorescences consisting of a spadix surrounded by a colorful spathe. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
